availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: August Coleman (Louisville, Kentucky, stonecutter and marble worker)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, stonecutter and marble worker. Native of Hesse. Married to Henrietta Herder Coleman. Father of Caroline Coleman and Eliza Coleman. Stonecutter in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1858. Stonecutter in Louisville in 1860. Marble worker in Louisville in 1861. Stone yard operator in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p. 456.
"Eliza Coleman," Illinois Death Certificates, 1916-1950, Illinois Department of Public Health, Division of Vital Records, Springfield, IL. Cook County, No. 20328.
